title: title about data science
section: What differences/similarities do you see between data scientists and statisticians?
text:
What differences/similarities do you see between data scientists and statisticians?
Other than salary and title? Officially, a data scientist combines computer science with statistics. But statisticians also program nowadays. The type of problems they work on could also be different. But in the end both are very similar with many overlapping skills.

Code Chunk of y. Determining class, type, and structure of y.

y <- density(iris$Petal.Width)
class(y)

[1] "density"

typeof(y)

[1] "list"

str(y)

List of 7
 $ x        : num [1:512] -0.656 -0.648 -0.64 -0.633 -0.625 ...
 $ y        : num [1:512] 0.00163 0.0018 0.00199 0.00219 0.00241 ...
 $ bw       : num 0.252
 $ n        : int 150
 $ call     : language density.default(x = iris$Petal.Width)
 $ data.name: chr "iris$Petal.Width"
 $ has.na   : logi FALSE
